title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This page analyzes the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita using the Gapminder dataset. The dataset includes data on life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for various countries over time.
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import seaborn as sns import pandas as pd

Load the Gapminder dataset
data = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”)


Create the plot
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6)) sns.scatterplot(data=data, x=“gdp_per_capita”, y=“life_expectancy”, alpha=0.5) plt.xscale(‘log’) plt.title(‘Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita’) plt.xlabel(‘GDP per Capita (log scale)’) plt.ylabel(‘Life Expectancy’) plt.grid(True) plt.show()

title: Country Analysis
text:
Country Analysis
This analysis explores the changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for a specific country over time. The data is visualized to provide insights into the trends and patterns observed in these key indicators.
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import seaborn as sns import pandas as pd import gapminder


Load the Gapminder dataset
data = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”) # Filter data for a specific country, e.g., ‘United States’ country_data = data[data[‘country’] == ‘United States’]


Create subplots
fig, axes = plt.subplots(3, 1, figsize=(10, 18), sharex=True)


Plot life expectancy over time
sns.lineplot(ax=axes[0], data=country_data, x=‘year’, y=‘life_expectancy’) axes[0].set_title(‘Life Expectancy Over Time’) axes[0].set_ylabel(‘Life Expectancy’)


Plot GDP per capita over time
sns.lineplot(ax=axes[1], data=country_data, x=‘year’, y=‘gdp_per_capita’) axes[1].set_title(‘GDP per Capita Over Time’) axes[1].set_ylabel(‘GDP per Capita’)


Plot population over time
sns.lineplot(ax=axes[2], data=country_data, x=‘year’, y=‘population_millions’) axes[2].set_title(‘Population Over Time’) axes[2].set_ylabel(‘Population’) axes[2].set_xlabel(‘Year’)
plt.tight_layout() plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
Life Expectancy and Population
This page analyzes the relationship between life expectancy and population using the Gapminder dataset. The dataset includes data on life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for various countries over time.
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import seaborn as sns import pandas as pd


Load the Gapminder dataset
data = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”) # Create the plot plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6)) sns.scatterplot(data=data, x=“population_millions”, y=“life_expectancy”, alpha=0.5) plt.xscale(‘log’) plt.title(‘Life Expectancy vs Population’) plt.xlabel(‘Population (log scale)’) plt.ylabel(‘Life Expectancy’) plt.grid(True) plt.show()
